### Runtime Environment
Using `spack@develop` w/ commit id `0b96082e7` from 20-May-2020 on `Ubuntu 18.04` for `x86_64`

### Problem
`spack install` isn't able to use the locally mirrored source of packages that rely on Git repositories, when the network is unavailable during `spack install`. The problem is easily illustrated below using the simple package `cinch@master` as an example. `cinch` has no explicit dependencies.

1. Create source cache for `cinch@master`
```
$> spack mirror create -D cinch@master
...
==> Adding package cinch@master to mirror
==> Successfully updated mirror in file:///opt/spack/var/spack/cache
  Archive stats:
    0    already present
    1    added
    0    failed to fetch.
```

2. Add the mirror

3. Disable network access

4. Try installing `cinch@master`
```
$> spack install cinch@master
```
